intro: Cyrtandra hapalantha, commonly known as the Haleakalā Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and mountainous regions. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces berries that are an important food source for native birds. Due to habitat loss and introduced species, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
